Logging

Interface ILoggerFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TraceLoggerFactory

    public interface ILoggerFactory
    This interface represents an abstract factory for creating and managing ILogger in a system. It features a public interface over which a client from other packages can interact and create logger (type ILogger).

    If a client want to use a default logger, its code could look like this:

    ILoggerFactory myLoggerFactory = ILoggerFactory.getInstance(); //get factory (most time singleton)
    ILogger myLogger = myLoggerFactory.createLogger(); //create default logger
    myLogger.info("This logger was created by an ILoggerFactory"); //example info message

    Which concrete factory is returned, is defined in getInstance(). The selection is static, but could be extended with parameters for decision making in future.

    For creating a logger, an ILoggerFactory provides three different methods:

    • createLogger() - creating a default logger with a default name.
    • createLogger(int) - creating a logger based on priority. This feature could be implemented with for example generating a different logger name or customizing the logger entries.
    • createLogger(String) - creating a logger with the given name.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    9045534
    See Also:
    ILogger

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ILogger createLogger()
      Returns a logger with the default name.
      ILogger createLogger(int priority)
      Returns a logger specified by a priority level.
      ILogger createLogger(java.lang.String loggerName)
      Returns a logger with the given name.
      static ILoggerFactory getInstance()
      With this method a client can get access to an ILoggerFactory.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        static ILoggerFactory getInstance()
        With this method a client can get access to an ILoggerFactory. The specification which factory will be returned is determined in this code section. As till now only the TraceLoggerFactory is supported, this one is returned.

        It is recommended to use a singleton method in the concrete factories.

        Returns:
        An ILoggerFactory with which the client can create logger for itself.

      • createLogger

        ILogger createLogger()
        Returns a logger with the default name.
        Returns:
        Logger with default name

      • createLogger

        ILogger createLogger(int priority)
        Returns a logger specified by a priority level.
        Parameters:
        priority - Importance of logging entries
        Returns:
        Logger fitting to given priority

      • createLogger

        ILogger createLogger(@NotNull
                     java.lang.String loggerName)
        Returns a logger with the given name.
        Parameters:
        loggerName - Name of the new logger
        Returns:
        Logger with given name
